template_input_params.name: bastion_host
template_input_params.description: Bastion host for ssh proxy
template_input_params.label: Bastion host

template_input_params.name: bastion_port
template_input_params.description: Bastion port for ssh proxy
template_input_params.label: Bastion port

template_input_params.name: bastion_user
template_input_params.description: Bastion user for ssh proxy
template_input_params.label: Bastion user

template_input_params.name: bastion_private_key
template_input_params.description: Bastion private key for ssh proxy
template_input_params.label: Bastion user private key

template_input_params.name: bastion_password
template_input_params.description: Bastion user password for ssh proxy
template_input_params.label: Bastion user password

template_input_params.name: bastion_host_key
template_input_params.description: Bastion host public key for ssh proxy
template_input_params.label: Bastion host key

template_input_params.name: docker_registry_token
template_input_params.description: Docker registry token used for accessing the docker registry to pull the Content Runtime docker images on to the native machine. This is used for internal development and not exposed to external users.
template_input_params.label: Docker Registry Token

template_input_params.name: docker_registry
template_input_params.description: Docker registry to pull the Content Runtime Docker images. The images by default reside on the public Docker hub. The value is read only. It provides you the location where an image is pulled.
template_input_params.label: Docker Registry

template_input_params.name: docker_registry_camc_pattern_manager_version
template_input_params.description: Content Runtime's Pattern Manager (PM) docker-image version to be installed. The version will reflect the shipped version. https://hub.docker.com/r/ibmcom/camc-pattern-manager/tags/
template_input_params.label: Pattern Manager Docker Tag

template_input_params.name: docker_registry_camc_sw_repo_version
template_input_params.description: Content Runtime's Software Repository (SW-Repo) docker-image version to be installed. The version will reflect the shipped version. https://hub.docker.com/r/ibmcom/camc-sw-repo/tags/
template_input_params.label: Software Repository (SW-Repo) docker-image version to be installed.

template_input_params.name: ibm_sw_repo_user
template_input_params.description: User name to access the Software Repository.
template_input_params.label: Software Repository User name

template_input_params.name: ibm_sw_repo_password
template_input_params.description: Password for Software Repository User. The combination of user name and password is required to access the Software Repository.
template_input_params.label: Password for Software Repository

template_input_params.name: ibm_sw_repo_port
template_input_params.description: Port number for Software Repository HTTP access.
template_input_params.label: Software Repository Port Number

template_input_params.name: ibm_sw_repo_secure_port
template_input_params.description: Port number for Software Repository HTTPS access.
template_input_params.label: Software Repository Secure Port Number

template_input_params.name: chef_client_version
template_input_params.description: Stable version of Chef client to install in the Software Repository.
template_input_params.label: Software Repository Chef Client Version

template_input_params.name: chef_client_path
template_input_params.description: Path to Chef client installation binaries.
template_input_params.label: Chef Client Installation Binaries Path

template_input_params.name: ibm_im_repo_user_hidden
template_input_params.description: User name to access the Installation Manager Repository.
template_input_params.label: Install Manager Repository User name

template_input_params.name: ibm_im_repo_password_hidden
template_input_params.description: Password to be used for the Installation Manager's new user. The combination of user name and password will be required to access the Installation Manager Repository.
template_input_params.label: Password for Installation Manager

template_input_params.name: ibm_contenthub_git_host
template_input_params.description: GitHub Domain, an internal field which can be used to switch between private and public repositories. This parameter is read only and used as an internal setting.
template_input_params.label: GitHub Domain

template_input_params.name: ibm_contenthub_git_organization
template_input_params.description: GitHub Organization Name used to pull the content cookbooks. This parameter is read only and used as an internal setting.
template_input_params.label: GitHub Content Organization Name

template_input_params.name: ibm_openhub_git_organization
template_input_params.description: Git Hub Organization Name used to pull the starter packs. This parameter is read only and used as an internal setting.
template_input_params.label: GitHub Open Organization Name

template_input_params.name: offline_installation
template_input_params.description: Is this an offline installation.
template_input_params.label: Offline

template_input_params.name: docker_ee_repo
template_input_params.description: This is an optional parameter. It is mandatory only if you use RHEL as the base image without Docker installed. RHEL supports Docker Enterprise Edition only. After you purchase the license, get the Docker Enterprise Edition Repository URL from https://store.docker.com/my-content. Docker Community Edition is used by default on other supported operating system.
template_input_params.label: Docker Enterprise Edition Repository URL

template_input_params.name: chef_org
template_input_params.description: Chef server Organization name that is associated with the configuration of the Chef server.
template_input_params.label: Chef server Organization Name

template_input_params.name: chef_admin
template_input_params.description: Chef administrator user name that is associated with the configuration of the Chef server.
template_input_params.label: Chef Administrator User name

template_input_params.name: byochef
template_input_params.description: Is this a bring your own Chef server deployment.
template_input_params.label: Bring Your Own Chef Server

template_input_params.name: install_cookbooks
template_input_params.description: Should the Chef cookbooks be installed on the provided Chef server?
template_input_params.label: Install Chef Cookbooks

template_input_params.name: chef_fqdn
template_input_params.description: Fully qualified domain name of a remote Chef server. Consists of the server's hostname and domain.
template_input_params.label: Chef Server FQDN

template_input_params.name: chef_ip
template_input_params.description: IPv4 address of a remote Chef server.
template_input_params.label: Chef Server IP Address

template_input_params.name: chef_pem
template_input_params.description: Certificate (.pem file) of the remote Chef server encoded in base64.
template_input_params.label: Chef Server Certificate - Base 64 encoded

template_input_params.name: ibm_pm_access_token
template_input_params.description: Passphrase used to access the REST API calls to the Pattern Manager.
template_input_params.label: Pattern Manager Access Passphrase

template_input_params.name: ibm_pm_admin_token
template_input_params.description: Administration passphrase that is used to access the administrative REST API calls to the Pattern Manager.
template_input_params.label: Pattern Manager Administration Passphrase

template_input_params.name: ibm_pm_public_ssh_key_name
template_input_params.description: For Amazon and IBM clouds, the key must exist as a resource. For other provider types, the content is simply the name associated with the key.
template_input_params.label: Key Name for Pattern Manager key set

template_input_params.name: ibm_pm_private_ssh_key
template_input_params.description: Private key to be used by Pattern Manager to communicate with the newly instantiated virtual machine. The key must be base64 encoded and must be associated with the public key named by the Key Name for Pattern Manager key set.
template_input_params.label: Private Key for Pattern Manager - Base 64 encoded

template_input_params.name: ibm_pm_public_ssh_key
template_input_params.description: Public key to be used by Pattern Manager to communicate with the newly instantiated virtual machine. The key must match the public key named by the Key Name for Pattern Manager key set.
template_input_params.label: Public Key for Pattern Manager

template_input_params.name: user_public_ssh_key
template_input_params.description: Public key that is added to the Content Runtime virtual machine's `authorized_keys` file so as to allow access using the associated private key.
template_input_params.label: User's Public Key

template_input_params.name: template_timestamp_hidden
template_input_params.description: Internal automatically updated variable containing the Content Runtime template timestamp
template_input_params.label: Template Timestamp

template_input_params.name: template_debug
template_input_params.description: Allow for the template parameters to be cached on the Content Runtime virtual machine for additional debug help in problem solving.
template_input_params.label: Template debug

template_input_params.name: runtime_hostname
template_input_params.description: The host name of the virtual machine being created to be used as the Content Runtime. The name is just the host name and not the fully qualified host name.
template_input_params.label: Content Runtime Host Name

template_input_params.name: vsphere_datacenter
template_input_params.description: The name of a Datacenter in which to launch the virtual machine.
template_input_params.label: vSphere Datacenter

template_input_params.name: vsphere_folder
template_input_params.description: Name of the vSphere folder where the virtual machine is created.
template_input_params.label: vSphere Folder

template_input_params.name: vsphere_datastore
template_input_params.description: Datastore for the created disks. Two disk are created, one for the OS template, the other for the data including the software repository content.
template_input_params.label: vSphere Disk Datastore

template_input_params.name: vsphere_default_resource_pool
template_input_params.description: Name of the default resource pool for the cluster. Specified as 'cluster_name/resource_pool'
template_input_params.label: vSphere Default Resource Pool

template_input_params.name: runtime_keep_on_remove
template_input_params.description: Should disks be kept on vSphere even if the virtual machine is destroyed?
template_input_params.label: Keep Disks On Remove

template_input_params.name: vsphere_adapter_type
template_input_params.description: Network interface type
template_input_params.label: vSphere Network Adapter Type

template_input_params.name: runtime_domain
template_input_params.description: Content Runtime Virtual Machine's domain name
template_input_params.label: Domain name

template_input_params.name: cores
template_input_params.description: The number of CPU cores to allocate for the Content Runtime. The default value is sufficient for the Content Runtime.
template_input_params.label: CPU cores

template_input_params.name: memory
template_input_params.description: The amount of RAM to allocate for the virtual machine. The default value is sufficient for the Content Runtime.
template_input_params.label: RAM

template_input_params.name: nfs_mount
template_input_params.description: Internal variable used to indicate how to allocate software storage
template_input_params.label: Internal variable

template_input_params.name: vsphere_dns
template_input_params.description: List of DNS servers for the virtual network adapter. For more than one DNS, the values can be entered by adding more fields.
template_input_params.label: DNS servers

template_input_params.name: vsphere_dns_suffix_list
template_input_params.description: List of DNS suffixes for the virtual network adapter. For more than one suffix, the values can be entered by adding more fields.
template_input_params.label: DNS suffix list

template_input_params.name: disk1_template
template_input_params.description: The folder/template name to use to configure the OS on the Content Runtime Virtual Machine.
template_input_params.label: OS Template Name

template_input_params.name: disk1_size
template_input_params.description: The size of the disk for the Content Runtime. It must be equal or larger than the provided image
template_input_params.label: Size of image disk (in GBs)

template_input_params.name: disk2_name
template_input_params.description: Name that will be assigned to the data hard drive when the new disk is created
template_input_params.label: Name for data hard drive

template_input_params.name: disk2_size
template_input_params.description: The size of the data disk for the Content Runtime, and Software Repository.
template_input_params.label: Size of data disk (in GBs)

template_input_params.name: network_label
template_input_params.description: Label to assign to this network interface.
template_input_params.label: Network interface label

template_input_params.name: ipv4_address
template_input_params.description: Static IPv4 address to be assigned to this network interface for the Content Runtime virtual machine. The address must be a static IP.
template_input_params.label: Static IPv4

template_input_params.name: ipv4_gateway
template_input_params.description: IPv4 gateway address to be used.
template_input_params.label: Gateway IP address

template_input_params.name: ipv4_netmask
template_input_params.description: Integer value between 1 and 32 for the prefix length, CIDR, to use when statically assigning an IPv4 address
template_input_params.label: IPv4 prefix length (CIDR)

template_input_params.name: vmware_image_ssh_user
template_input_params.description: The user name to use while configuring the Content Runtime virtual machine.
template_input_params.label: Template image's user name

template_input_params.name: vmware_image_ssh_password
template_input_params.description: The password to use for the provided SSH user name while configuring the Content Runtime virtual machine. The password is optional if an SSH key is provided.
template_input_params.label: Template image's password

template_input_params.name: vmware_image_ssh_private_key
template_input_params.description: A base 64 encoded SSH private key used for configuring the Content Runtime virtual machine. This key is optional if a password is specified.
template_input_params.label: Template image's private key for SSH connection - Base 64 encoded

template_input_params.name: network_visibility
template_input_params.description: The network connection associated with the Content Runtime virtual machine instance. If network visibility is private, connection must exist from the IBM Cloud Private to the network connection associated with the Content Runtime virtual machine being created.
template_input_params.label: Network Visibility

template_input_params.name: prereq_strictness
template_input_params.description: If set to strict, the prerequisite checker stops execution if one or more requirements is not installed. If set to lenient,  If set to lenient, the prerequisite checker proceeds to install any missing requirement.
template_input_params.label: Prerequisite checker strictness

template_input_params.name: portable_private_ip
template_input_params.description: Portable private IP
template_input_params.label: Portable IP

template_input_params.name: encryption_passphrase
template_input_params.description: Passphrase for encrypted drives
template_input_params.label: File system encryption passphrase

template_input_params.name: installer_docker
template_input_params.description: Optional file location of a docker .deb/.rpm file to be installed on the system
template_input_params.label: Docker installation file

template_input_params.name: installer_docker_compose
template_input_params.description: Optional file location of a Docker Compose executable file to be installed on the system
template_input_params.label: Docker Compose installation file

template_input_params.name: sw_repo_image
template_input_params.description: Optional file location of the Software Repository Docker image to be loaded to the system
template_input_params.label: Software Repository Docker image location

template_input_params.name: pm_image
template_input_params.description: Optional file location of the Pattern Manager Docker image to be loaded to the system
template_input_params.label: Pattern Manager Docker image location

template_input_params.name: chef_version
template_input_params.description: Stable version of Chef server to install
template_input_params.label: Chef Server Version

template_output_params.name: docker_registry_token
template_output_params.description: Docker registry token used for accessing the docker registry to pull the Content Runtime docker images on to the native machine. This is used for internal development and not exposed to external users.
template_output_params.label: Docker Registry Token
